claim: Recombinant technology leads to a broader immune response that may provide cross-protection, even in a mismatch season.

rejected_evidence.quote: because it is not subject to mutations to the A (H3 N2) glycosylation binding site that reduce the effectiveness of egg based vaccines.
rejected_evidence.original_explanation: This quote supports the claim by indicating that recombinant technology avoids certain mutations that can limit the effectiveness of traditional (egg-based) vaccines, suggesting a broader or more robust immune response.
